9.Let  $P(x)$  bethestatement  $^{1}\!x$  canspeak Russian'and let  $Q(x)$  bethestatement  $^{1}\!x$  knows the computer language  $C^{++n}$  .Expresseach of the following sentence in termsof  $P(x),Q(x)$  ,quantifiers,and logical connectives.For the universe of discourse for quantifiers use the set of all students at your school 
a)There is a student at your school who can speak Russian andwhoknows  ${\mathsf{C}}^{++}$  b)a) There is a student atyour school who can speak Russian but who does notknow  ${\mathsf{C}}^{++}$  c)Every student atyour school either can speak Russian orknows  ${\mathsf{C}}^{++}$  d)No student at your school speakRussian orknows  ${\mathsf{C}}^{++}$  

$$
\begin{array}{l l}{S o l u t i o n:\mathsf{a})\quad\exists x(P(x)\land Q(x))}\\ {\mathsf{b})\quad\exists x(P(x)\land\neg Q(x))}\\ {\mathsf{z})\quad\forall x(P(x)\lor Q(x))}\\ {\mathsf{d})\quad\forall x\neg(P(x)\lor Q(x))}\end{array}
$$
 
62. Let  $P(x),\ Q(x),\ R(x)$  and  $S(x)$  bethestatement  $^{u}x$  is a duck,"  $^{u}x$  is one of my poultry.”“  $^{1}\boldsymbol{x}$  is anofficer,"and‘  $^{\iota}\!x$  is willing to waltz,respectively.Express the following statements using quantifiers;logical connectives;and  $P(x),\,Q(x),\,R(x)$  and  $S(x)$  
a)No ducks are willing to waltz b)No officers ever decline to waltz c)All my poultry are ducks
